article.headline: William &amp, Mary 80, Drexel 66
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. -- Brandon Britt scored 25 points and Quinn McDowell had 23 points to help William & Mary snap a seven-game losing streak with an 80-66 victory over Drexel on Saturday night. The Tribe (5-12, 1-5 Colonial Athletic Association) shot 76.5 percent from the field (13 of 17) and 80 percent from the free-throw line (20 of 25) in the second half. William & Mary used a 9-1 run in the second half to pull away from Drexel (11-5, 3-3), which entered leading the country in 3-point defense and the CAA in scoring defense and opponents' field goal percentage. Tim Rusthoven scored four points and JohnMark Ludwick hit a 3-pointer as the Tribe extended their lead to 48-36 with 12:15 to play. The Tribe shot 50 percent from the 3-point line (7 of 14). Rusthoven had 12 points. Drexel's Gerald Colds hit seven 3-pointers and had 22 points, Chris Fouch had 13 and Samme Givens had 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
